app.core.models package¶

Submodules¶

app.core.models.ab_module module¶

class app.core.models.ab_module.ABModule(play_2: Player_2_data, nb_day: Literal[0, 1, 2, 3, 4], translation_module: Translate)¶

Bases: EmbedPort

The ABModule class, which is a subclass of EmbedPort, is responsible for managing the game play and statistics of members playing a game involving bombs and attacks.

Parameters:

  • play_2 (Player_2_data) – The Player_2_data instance containing the game play data for the second player.

  • nb_day (Literal[0, 1, 2, 3, 4]) – The number of days passed since the game started. Must be between 0 and 4 inclusive.

  • translation_module (Translate) – The Translate instance used to manage translations for different languages.

members¶

List of MemberBombAttacks instances for each guild member.

Type:

List[MemberBombAttacks]

lang¶

Language used for translations.

Type:

str

translations¶

A dictionary containing translated text for ABModule.

Type:

Dict[str, Union[str, Dict[str, str]]]

nb_day¶

The number of days passed since the game started.

Type:

Literal[0, 1, 2, 3, 4]

_members_missing_something¶

List of MemberBombAttacks instances for each member who has remaining bombs or attacks.

Type:

List[MemberBombAttacks]

Attributes:
lang
members
nb_day
play_2
translations

Methods

description()

Determines the description of the embed based on the current game state.

embed_fields()

Generates a list of tuples to be used for adding fields to the embed.

title()

Determines the title of the embed based on the number of days passed since the game started.
description() → str¶

Determines the description of the embed based on the current game state. The description varies based on whether it’s a rest day, all attacks and bombs are used, or there are still remaining attacks and bombs.

Returns:

The description of the embed.

Return type:

str

embed_fields() → list[tuple[str, str]]¶

Generates a list of tuples to be used for adding fields to the embed. Each tuple consists of the member’s name and their game play status.

Returns:

List of tuples for adding fields to the embed.

Return type:

list[tuple[str, str]]

lang¶
members¶
nb_day¶
play_2¶
title() → str¶

Determines the title of the embed based on the number of days passed since the game started.

Returns:

The title of the embed.

Return type:

str

translations¶

app.core.models.api_solgard.connect_and_set_session_id(user_id: str, connect_json: dict[str, Any]) → str¶

Sends a POST request to the Solgard API to connect and set the session_id.

app.core.models.b_module module¶

class app.core.models.b_module.BModule(play_2: Player_2_data, translation_module: Translate)¶

Bases: EmbedPort

BModule is an implementation of the abstract EmbedPort base class. It generates embed data for members with remaining bombs in a game.

play_2¶

The Player_2_data instance containing the game play data for the second player.

Type:

Player_2_data

members¶

List of MemberBombAttacks instances representing each member’s bombs attacks status.

Type:

list[MemberBombAttacks]

_members_missing_bomb¶

List of MemberBombAttacks instances for each member who has remaining bombs.

Type:

list[MemberBombAttacks]

translations¶

The translations dictionary for “b_module” from the provided translation module.

Type:

dict

Attributes:
members
play_2
translations

Methods

description()

Defines the description of the embed.

embed_fields()

Returns a list of tuples for the Embed object's fields.

title()

Defines the title of the embed based on the translations provided.
description() → str¶

Defines the description of the embed. The description contains information about remaining bombs and the names of the members who haven’t used their bombs.

Returns:

The description of the embed.

Return type:

str

app.core.models.bc_module module¶

Bases: EmbedPort

The BCModule class is used for calculating and maintaining information about the powers of the allies and enemies in a clash.
